row.entry: If all required settings in source imageand reference valuesare ready you can move to the processtab.

body.p: You first need to tell darktable-chartwhich of the patches represent the gray ramp. In the screenshot displayed further above the gray ramp is positioned in the lower part of the color reference chart, denoted as GS00...GS23.
The input number of final patchesdefines how many editable color patches the resulting style will use within the color look up tablemodule (for more details see Color look up table).
By clicking the processbutton you start the calculation.

The quality of the result in terms of average delta E and maximum delta E are displayed below the button. These data show how close the resulting style applied to the source image will be able to match the reference values â€“ the lower the better.

row.entry: Once you are happy with the result you can click on exportand save the generated style.

body.p: You supply a style name and a style description under which the style will later appear in darktable. darktable-chartsaves the style as a .dtstylefile which can be imported into darktable (see Quick access to styles) and shared with others.

The export raw data as csvbutton allows you to save the extracted raw data as a CSV file for debugging purposes or later usage. darktable-chartoffers a command line option to produce a style with the desired number of final patches from a supplied CSV file (see darktable-chart binary).
